result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela N Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.
Pay costs of supervision, court obligations and DNA surcharge.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.   Absolute sobriety is required.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angela N Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Resolution reached.  State has filed amended information.  Offer:  Plea to cts 1 and 3 of amended information; dismiss/read-in cts 2 and 4.  Will recommend 1 yr probation.
Plea questionnaire filed.
Court colloquy re elements of crime and possible penalties.
PLEA - guilty each of 2 counts
Plea accepted as freely and voluntarily given.
Finding of guilt; counts 2 and 4 will be dismissed
State's sentencing argument
Defense sentencing argument
Defendant speaks on own behalf
BTC:  1 yr probation
absolute sobriety - no alcohol, controlled substances, RUAs, AODA
full-time emp/school
30 hrs CSW
$200 fine
$200 DNA surcharge
10 days CFTS per attorney
To Compel Disclosure Of Confidential Informant
Motion hearing on April 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Angela N Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Requesting a motion date.
BTC: Adj  Motion hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant, DJB.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 01-27-2016: No contact condition is removed.**

Defendant Angela N Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense requests bond mod.
State takes no position.
BTC: Modification granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
ATTY Cafferty files bond review motion.

Defendant Angela N Jackson in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense requests adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant, DJB.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Angela N Jackson in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Angela N Jackson in custody.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
